title: Direct Observation of Strain-Induced Ferrochiral Transition in Quasi-1D BaTiS3
content: Ferrochiral materials have simultaneous mirror symmetry breaking and inversion symmetry breaking. The former results in chirality, and the latter in electric polarization [1, 2]. A strong coupling between these two order parameters opens up the prospect of switching chirality with an applied electric field, thus making ferrochiral materials an attractive class of multiferroics.
